info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 3:04PM EST until December 22 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM FRIDAY TO NOON EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. Winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Bradford county. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM Friday to noon EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the afternoon commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Also, tree limbs could be blown down and scattered power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition to cold wind chills, temperatures will quickly drop below freezing late Friday morning and through the afternoon. This will likely result in a flash freeze and icy road conditions.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.
